result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chimar Ryan McCoy

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chimar Ryan McCoy in court.  Attorney Scott Alan Wales Aty in court for Chimar Ryan McCoy.  Prosecuting attorney Francesco Mineo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Parties are still in negotiation posture. For reasons stated on the record court grants Parties request for plea/DPA hearing date. Court reiterated conditions of bail. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chimar Ryan McCoy in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Francesco Mineo.
Case in court for an arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense informs the court of ongoing negotiations and requests a status date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Court advised defendant that any previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 AM.

Defendant Chimar Ryan McCoy in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Kissler  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defense Request an arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chimar Ryan McCoy in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Wales recently retained, case is adjourned for a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 067122,
Payable Number: 1019932,
Receipt Number: 22RP028599,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Chimar Ryan McCoy in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Indigency hearing. Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding status of counsel. Defendant request additional time to retain counsel. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Indigency hearing on June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Chimar Ryan McCoy in court, appear by video. Defendant appears without counsel.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing. Indigency hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Potawatomi Bingo Casino, SG, KY, and BM.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 05/05/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Chimar Ryan McCoy in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/03/2022@02:00pm
